column1: fp1_yearly.0001.desc0:"Thralls are a fact of life in [ROOT.Char.GetCulture.GetNameNoTooltip] culture. Lower humans
column2: captured from abroad or born of thralls themselves
column3:
they work our fields and care for our hearths.

In theory.

Last night
column4: one such slave decided [dummy_gender.GetSheHe] had had enough
column5: and fled
column6: taking an armful of valuable jewelry with [dummy_gender.GetHerHim]! What's worse
column7: [scapegoat.Custom2('MyCharacterIntroduction'
column8: ROOT.Char)] #EMP saw#! the thrall rushing into the dark
column9: and didn't think to tell anyone till the morning.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0001.a0:"Send a description to every village!":""
fp1_yearly.0001.a.tt_success0:"The thrall is spotted and captured":""
fp1_yearly.0001.a.tt_failure0:"The thrall slips the net with your silver":""
fp1_yearly.0001.b.tt_success0:"You catch the thrall before they can get far":""

column3: so you can pay!":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0011.t0:"Calls for [offensive_courtier.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] to be Declared Nithing":""
fp1_yearly.0011.desc0:"A parade of important locals from [capital_barony.GetNameNoTier] have spent the day trooping through my hall
column2: each one with a unique grievance against my [ROOT.Char.Custom2('RelationToMeShort'
column3: SCOPE.sC('offensive_courtier'))]
column4: [offensive_courtier.GetTitledFirstName].\n\nSome complain about [offensive_courtier.GetHerHis] behavior
column5: others [offensive_courtier.GetHerHis] honor
column6: but all agree on one thing: [offensive_courtier.GetSheHe] is a disgrace to the court.\n\nThe unwashed masses call for nothing less than a declaration of nithing
column7: casting [offensive_courtier.GetHerHim] out.":""

column2: ROOT.Char)|U] insists that [offensive_courtier.GetHerHis] behavior is #EMP actually#! quite pious
column3: but the snarling burghers claim [priest.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] simply doesn't have to deal with the consequences of such virtue"".""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0011.d0:"This isn't a matter for the [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip]...":""
fp1_yearly.0021.t0:"A Matter of Life and Death":""
fp1_yearly.0021.desc.intro0:"A recent argument between two of my $knight_culture_player_plural_no_tooltip_lowercase$
column3: has escalated drastically. Apparently
column4:
:"
 fp1_yearly.0021.desc.doggo0":"[first_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] skewered [second_knight.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] dog by accident as they hunted a [ROOT.Char.Custom('LocalAnimal')] together
column5: and [second_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] refuses to let [first_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] simply pay for a new one.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0021.desc.spit_of_land0:"[first_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] bought a remote spit of land that [second_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] claims belongs to [second_knight.GetHerHim]. The plot would be worthless
column2: save that it supposedly grows the best cabbages in all [capital_barony.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip].":""

column3: a goat
column4: and a good drinking horn.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0021.desc.escalating_prank_war0:"it started as a harmless contest of one-upmanship
column2: each playing increasingly dramatic jokes on the other
column3: and the fun has gradually turned to pure rage.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0021.desc.religious_differences0:"it comes down to simple differences in faith
column2: with [first_knight.GetFaith.GetAdherentName] and [second_knight.GetFaith.GetAdherentName] both at each others' throats over the nature of the divine.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0021.desc.stolen_pig0:"the key point of contention is a colossal prize pig
column2: which [first_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] stole from [second_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip]. Or [second_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] from [first_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip]. Honestly
column3: with all the yelling
column4: it's quite unclear.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0021.desc.defiled_longboat.woman0:"[unfortunate_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] found [defiling_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] #EMP enjoying#! [defiling_knight.GetHerselfHimself] with the figurehead of [unfortunate_knight.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] longboat
column2: utterly ruining both the paintwork and its once-fearsome aura.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0021.desc.defiled_longboat0:"[defiling_knight.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] #EMP enjoyed#! [defiling_knight.GetHerselfHimself] unspeakably all over every seat in [unfortunate_knight.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] longboat
fp1_yearly.0021.desc.board_game0:"the two were playing a game of hnefatafl and got to arguing about the exact rules. In minutes
column2: the board was swept aside and fists were flying.":""
both $knight_culture_player_plural_no_tooltip_lowercase$ have openly challenged each other to holmgang. The duel is sure to be dramatic
column3: but as sworn members of my household
column4: they need my permission to go ahead with the fight.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0021.a0:"They may fight over this if they wish.":""
fp1_yearly.0021.b.tt_failure0:"Your $knight_culture_player_plural_no_tooltip_lowercase$ agree begrudgingly but mock you":""

column2: long evening in the company of [lying_warrior.GetFirstName]. The wanderer stopped in [capital_barony.GetBaseNameNoTierNoTooltip] for the night
column3: paying for [lying_warrior.GetHerHis] stay with tales of [lying_warrior.GetHerHis] exploits that have lasted #EMP hours#!.\n\n":""

column2: in the middle of the North Sea
column3: longboat sinking from too much bloody plunder. Well
column4: I couldn't take it with me
column5: so I jumped into the water and swam to Norway!""""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0031.desc.wrestled_whale0:"... knew that I either had to abandon my crew
column2: or fight the whale myself. Grabbed my knife
column3: plunged into the ocean
column4: and wrestled the beast to shore single-handed!""""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0031.desc.charged_city_fruit_knife0:"... ten thousand of the enemy in there
column3: and me armed only with a small knife for peeling fruit. #EMP I made it#!
column4: thanks to my trusty fruit knife!""""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0031.desc.charged_city0:"... charged right up to the city walls
column3: and hacked my way into the royal palace. Melted the king's crown down to pay for a new pair of boots.""""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0031.desc.kept_iceland_afloat0:"... and if the two giants actually #EMP had#! gone ahead with their holmgang
column2: Iceland would surely have sunk back into the sea. Lucky I talked them down
column3: really.""""":""

column2: now #EMP that#! is the best I've ever had. [disparaged_king.GetTitledFirstNameNoTooltip] wasn't such a fan of me after that
column3: though
column4: and I fled [disparaged_king.GetHerHis] court sharpish
column5: I'll tell you that!""""":""

column2: this most recent wound is from the troll itself. Big as a house
column3: quiet as a mouse
column4: claws like the bastard spawn of [lying_warrior.GetFaith.DevilName]. Still
column5: stab anything long enough
column6: and it dies.""""":""

column3: each anecdote longer and larger than the last.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0031.a0:"You simply #EMP must#! stay at court
fp1_yearly.0031.c0:"Do speak well of our hospitality at your next stop!":""

column3: scholar
column4: and envoy from [sponsoring_liege.GetTitledFirstName] of [sponsoring_liege.GetPrimaryTitle.GetName] has been touring my lands of late. An erudite and devout [explorer.GetFaith.GetAdherentNameNoTooltip]
column5: [explorer.GetSheHe] keeps a detailed journal of [explorer.GetHerHis] experiences
column6: sending irregular letters back to [explorer.GetHerHis] homeland to report on life at this edge of the world.\n\n[explorer.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] has now reached [capital_barony.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip]
column7: and seeks permission to stop for a few days in order to observe our local customs and speak to our wisest elders.\n\nDespite the formal manner of [explorer.GetHerHis] request

column1: fp1_yearly.0041.a0:"Perhaps [explorer.GetSheHe] could observe one of our minor blots?":""
fp1_yearly.0041.c0:"We have no place for snooty foreigners at #EMP my#! court.":""

fp1_yearly.0051.desc0:"[draugr.GetTitledFirstNamePossessive] death some time ago did not go unmarked by the common people of [capital_county.GetNameNoTier]. Whatever else [draugr.GetSheHe] may have been
column2: [draugr.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] was not popular with the local peasantry
column3: and it has become the norm for every ill in the land to be blamed on the [draugr.Custom('WomanManPossessive')] walking corpse.\n\nNot a week seems to go by any more without every farmer
column4: forester
column5: and dung-shoveller within spitting distance of the capital complaining about [draugr.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] draugr.\n\n#EMP Something#! must be done.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0051.a.tt0:"You decide to investigate in the flesh...":""
fp1_yearly.0051.b0:"Just dig up the body and burn it.":""
fp1_yearly.0051.c0:"Perhaps we can solve this with protective spells?":""
fp1_yearly.0051.c.tt_success0:"Your potions and spells reassure the peasantry":""

fp1_yearly.0061.desc0:"My retinue and I have barely arrived at [draugr.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] barrow when the first snarl echoes out from inside.\n\nAs the largest wolf I've ever seen squeezes out through the darkened entrance
column2: the rest of its pack seems to spring from the ground itself. There must be a dozen or more
column3: each as large as a man
column4: and already at a dead-run from every direction.\n\nThe peasants were wrong about the draugr
column5: but not about the curse!":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0061.a.tt_success0:"You rally your men and slaughter the wolves!":""
fp1_yearly.0061.a.tt_failure0:"You barely escape with your life":""
fp1_yearly.0062.desc0:"[draugr.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] barrow is cold and gloomy. Though neither my retinue nor I see any walking corpse
column3: deep scratches on some of the walls
column4: and the bones of livestock litter the floor.\n\nA sudden rustling from the corner catches my eye
column5: and what I'd take to be a pile of leaves begins to stand up
column6: unveiling the largest bear I've ever seen
column7: easily nine or ten ells tall. It blinks sleepily at us

column1: fp1_yearly.0062.a0:"I'll make you into a rug!":""
fp1_yearly.0062.a.tt_failure0:"Your retinue drag you away from certain death":""

column3: nor even a corpse. A brief search of the area finds [draugr.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] upended in a ditch and crudely covered with foliage just a little ways away.\n\nInstead
column4: the grave seems to have been converted into a crude dwelling
column5: one which some dastardly outlaw has taken from the cold hands of the dead.\n\nAs I discuss what to do with my retinue
column6: a cheery whistling becomes audible in the distance
column7: getting closer. The rogue approaches!":""

column3: get up against the walls!":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0063.a.tt_failure0:"[draugr_nithing.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] notices something is amiss and runs":""
fp1_yearly.0063.b0:"What a waste of my bloody time!":""
fp1_yearly.0064.desc0:"The peasants may have insisted that [draugr.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] walking corpse was stealing their food
column3: and pawing at their windows at night
column4: but when I get to [draugr.GetHerHis] barrow
column5: I find a very different beast.\n\nAmidst a nest of stolen furs and half-eaten food sits an orphaned child
column6: staring at me
column7: eyes wide with utter terror.":""

column2: to the dungeon with this thief!":""

column3: 'girl'
column4: 'boy')]: a grave is no place for the living.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0064.d0:"Surely... surely every child deserves a [ROOT.Char.GetMotherFather]?":""

fp1_yearly.0065.desc0:"[draugr.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] barrow is much as it was when [draugr.GetSheHe] was buried. As is every other grave the peasants have me check.\n\nNor do I find anything in any supposedly-cursed cave
column3: or giant's grotto: after a few weeks
column4: I'm beginning to question quite how sure we are that such monsters truly even #EMP exist#!?\n\nAt least the exercise does me good.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0071.t0:"In the Deep Places of the World":""
fp1_yearly.0071.desc.intro0:"The peasants of [ROOT.Char.GetCapitalLocation.GetCounty.GetTitle.GetNameNoTier] are a superstitious bunch
column2: regularly coming to me with claims of sorcerers
column3: giants
column4: and gods in disguise.\n\nUsually
column5: I ignore such claims as commoner theatrics
column6: but this time they bring evidence:":""

column2: his head crushed to powder and pulp
column3: and the wailing parents who witnessed his death.":""
soft heart-flesh devoured.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0071.desc.troll_type.wolverine0:"a jumble of bones and torn flesh fragments that they insist was recently an elderly washerwoman.":""

column2: each torn apart too carefully for an uncoordinated wild animal
column3: but unmistakably the work of claws rather than a knife.":""

column2: clearly torn apart but not eaten
column3: nor even chewed on
column4: crudely shredded by no claws I've ever seen.":""

column1:
fp1_yearly.0071.desc.outro.loveli_lakes0:"

I have picked over the mess for only a short time when [loveli_lakes.GetTitledFirstName] steps forward.

This is no troll
column3: this is the work of a feral møøse! I know the beast well
column4: including its nasty bite
column5: and would carve my mark on its corpse.""""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0071.desc.outro.fallback0:"\n\nThe locals insist this is nothing less than the work of a troll
column2: and demand I scour nearby woods to dispatch for the creature.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0071.a.tt0:"You set off with a band of warriors":""
fp1_yearly.0071.b.tt_success0:"Your marshal and [marshal.GetHerHis] troops hunt down the monster":""
fp1_yearly.0071.c0:"Sounds like a bear. Deal with it yourselves
fp1_yearly.0081.hunt_invalidated0:"Hunt for the Troll of [ROOT.Char.GetCapitalLocation.GetCounty.GetTitle.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip] Ceases":""
fp1_yearly.0081.desc.prelude0:"The woods whisper gently as we trudge forwards
column2: holding my small party of retainers in a tight
column3: shadowy embrace. I fancy it's just the wind
column4: but some say trolls sing like the wind when alone...\n\nSeveral disappearances have happened near this clearing
column5: making it a likely camp for the beast. At least
column6: that's what the locals say.\n\n":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0081.desc0:"$fp1_yearly.0081.desc.prelude$An ear-shattering growl reverberates across the grove
column2: and something I'd taken to be a boulder rears up
column3: showing itself to be a positively #EMP towering#! bear.\n\n$fp1_yearly.0081.desc.finisher$":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0081.a.tt_failure0:"The bear rips you in two":""
fp1_yearly.0081.b.tt0:"You tear the beast in half in a berserk fury":""

column3: you Wolves of [ROOT.Char.GetCapitalLocation.GetTitle.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip]!":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0081.c.tt_success0:"You inspire your soldiers to kill the bear":""
fp1_yearly.0081.c.tt_failure0:"The beast injures you and escapes":""
fp1_yearly.0081.c.tt_failure.tt0:"You suffer a #warning PERMANENT#! major injury":""

column3: and then someone at the rear of the party screams. I whirl just in time to dodge the giant wolf
column4: fur flecked silver with age and red with blood
column5: as it dashes past. $fp1_yearly.0081.desc.finisher$":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0082.a.tt_failure0:"The wolf tears your throat out":""

column3: and kill the wolf":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0083.desc0:"$fp1_yearly.0081.desc.prelude$The first thing we see of the beast is it tearing the throat out of the soldier to my left: a swift-moving ball of fur and teeth barely larger than a dog but faster that a plunging sword. A frenzied wolverine! $fp1_yearly.0081.desc.finisher$":""
fp1_yearly.0083.a.tt_failure0:"The wolverine rips your guts out":""
fp1_yearly.0083.c0:"There's a hunting lodge near here
fp1_yearly.0083.c.tt_success0:"You lure it close to the lodge and overwhelm it with numbers":""

column3: but I can #EMP just#! make out the crouched form of a lynx on the other side of the clearing. One more unwary step might have been my last. $fp1_yearly.0081.desc.finisher$":""
we'll flush it towards you...":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0084.c.tt_success0:"You out-think and out-hunt the lynx":""

column2: it's a short trip to the rabid beast's forest lair.\n\nWould that we were lucky enough to catch the thing sleeping
column3: but we do not
column4: and the titanic
column5: feral monster rears up as we enter its clearing
column6: easily twice the height of a [ROOT.Char.GetWomanMan].\n\nIt breaths erratically
column7: its eyes rolling with a violent sickness of the mind

column1: fp1_yearly.0085.desc.fallback0:"$fp1_yearly.0081.desc.prelude$The silence breaks with an almighty #EMP crash#! as a titanic
column2: rabid moose bursts onto the scene
column3: twice the height of a [ROOT.Char.GetWomanMan]
column4: nostrils flaring with foam and anger. $fp1_yearly.0081.desc.finisher$":""

fp1_yearly.0085.c0:"Weak spot at the base of the neck! Spears and bows only!":""

fp1_yearly.0091.desc0:"A [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNamePossessiveNoTooltip] longship says much about [ROOT.Char.GetHerHim]. It tells you how rich [ROOT.Char.GetSheHe] is
column3: what image [ROOT.Char.GetSheHe] wishes to project to the rest of the world.\n\nI look at my current craft and deem it... lacking. As if to punctuate the thought
column4: a piece of the rigging comes loose with a crack
column5: the whole vessel creaking ominously as it redistributes pressure.\n\nCommissioning a new ship is simple enough
column6: but is a simple replacement good enough? Don't I deserve a vessel that tells the world about #EMP me#!?":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0091.d0:"I have no need for a costly craft.":""
fp1_yearly.0101.desc0:"Riddles are a beloved pastime among the [ROOT.Char.GetCulture.GetNameNoTooltip]. Two or more players will exchange increasingly tough problems
column2: often rhyming and steeped in allegory or myth.\n\nOn one particularly long
column3: lazy day
column4: [riddler.Custom2('MyCharacterIntroduction'
column5: ROOT.Char)] thinks to challenge me to a game
column6: with what must be half the people at court watching.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0101.a0:"You test #EMP my#! speechcraft? This'll be fun!":""
fp1_yearly.0101.b0:"I think I've read a few books on riddles...":""
fp1_yearly.0101.c0:"To start: who has no brain and is going to the dungeon?":""
fp1_yearly.0101.c.tt_nickname0:"Your courtiers whisper behind your back...":""

column3: and I have things to do.":""

as though the knave's bloody thoughts wandered#!.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0501.desc0:"There are many reasons for me to ply the waters near [ROOT.Char.GetCapitalLocation.GetTitle.GetNameNoTier] in times of peace: to show power
column3:
even simply to fish or enjoy the sea breeze.

We are on such a petty voyage when I spot a local vessel floundering in the distance.

Even from here
column4: it's clear that it's taken damage while out raiding
column5: its crew just barely keeping it afloat as they pail out water with silver goblets and ceramic bowls. The sight would be comical if it wasn't so serious.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0501.a0:"Stop and try to help them!":""
fp1_yearly.0501.a.tt_failure0:"The ship sinks with all hands":""
fp1_yearly.0501.b0:"We can keep the loot if we kill the survivors...":""
fp1_yearly.0511.desc0:"#EMP This smell is completely unbearable#!.\n\nIt's been a solid month since [stinker.GetFirstName] brought down that blasted [ROOT.Char.Custom('LocalAnimal')] while hunting
column2: and [stinker.GetSheHe]'s #EMP still#! carrying its maggot-ridden head around with [stinker.GetHerHim].\n\nEveryone in [ROOT.Char.GetCapitalLocation.GetTitle.GetNameNoTier] is sick of it
column3: but [stinker.GetSheHe] refuses to be rid of the damned thing.\n\nThe rest of the court has finally had enough
column4: it seems
column5: and forced [stinker.GetHerHim] to come to me for a verdict.":""

column3: very
column4: nice.":""

column3: and [ROOT.Char.GetFaith.HouseholdGodName] too

column1: fp1_yearly.0551.desc0:"It began as an occasional treat. An unusual habit

fp1_yearly.0591.desc0:"Ting-meets are a necessary chore for any decent [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip]
column2: with all the free [dummy_gender.GetWomenMen] in the area turning up to discuss local affairs
column3: market
column4: and jostle for this privilege or that.\n\nAs to be expected with such large gatherings
column5: they have a way of turning heated
column6: and this Ting is no exception.\n\nI struggle to follow the details through all the yelling
column7: but it seems as though [dummy_gender.GetWomenMen] from [county_a.GetNameNoTier]":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0591.desc.border_dispute0:"are squabbling over a village along the border with [county_b.GetNameNoTier]
column2: with both groups claiming the land.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0591.desc.stolen_flocks0:"accuse a prominent magnate from [county_b.GetNameNoTier] of stealing their flocks.":""

fp1_yearly.0591.desc.drunken_arson0:"are protesting their innocence in a spate of drunken arsons in [county_b.GetNameNoTier].":""
fp1_yearly.0591.desc.lost_dog0:"claim a village's iconic dog has been stolen by jealous [county_b.GetNameNoTier] louts.":""
fp1_yearly.0591.desc.disrupted_wedding0:"demand restitution for a wedding thrown into chaos by sozzled guests from [county_b.GetNameNoTier].":""
fp1_yearly.0591.desc.suspicious_will0:"are insisting on the validity of a will that leaves them large strips of land in [county_b.GetNameNoTier].":""
fp1_yearly.0591.desc.sheltered_criminal0:"have given shelter to a criminal from [county_b.GetNameNoTier].":""
fp1_yearly.0591.desc.bad_luck0:"are crying that they've been bewitched and cursed by spellcasters from [county_b.GetNameNoTier].":""
fp1_yearly.0591.desc.fly_tipping0:"being stubborn about fly-tipping the rubbish of a town along the border with [county_b.GetNameNoTier].":""

fp1_yearly.0591.c0:"Are good [county_a.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip][dummy_gender.GetWomenMen] going to take this from #EMP [county_b.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip]#!?":""
fp1_yearly.0591.d0:"They'll all tire themselves out eventually.":""

I am required to be here.

Growing older every second.

Watching the [dummy_gender.GetWomenMen] of [county.GetNameNoTier] talk each other to death.

Wishing for a war to save me from this living hell.":""

fp1_yearly.0631.desc0:"Upon returning from a successful raid
column2: every good [ROOT.Char.GetCulture.GetNameNoTooltip][cynic.GetWomanMan] knows to sacrifice a little of their gains to [ROOT.Char.GetFaith.PantheonTerm].\n\nEvery good [ROOT.Char.GetCulture.GetNameNoTooltip] except [cynic.GetTitledFirstName]
column3: that is.\n\nAs the rest of us divide up the spoils
column4: boasting of our best pieces and discussing which we'll give in thanks for good fortune and fair winds
column5: I notice that [cynic.GetSheHe] remains silent.\n\nUpon confronting the [cynic.GetWomanMan]
column6: [cynic.GetSheHe] even admits it: I saw no hand of [cynic.GetFaith.PantheonTerm] in our raid
column7: my [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip]
column8: only my own hands doing my own work. My share is for me.""""":""

column3: the heart of a [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNamePossessiveNoTooltip] power. Without access to the sea

column8: their carefully-clinked hulls in danger of coming apart once returned to the water.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.0651.desc0:"It behooves a [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip] to spend time at sea
column2: with the salty air in [ROOT.Char.GetHerHis] face and a fine vessel beneath [ROOT.Char.GetHerHis] feet. Today sees my personal craft and a small escorting squadron out for drills
column3: practice
column4: and pleasure.\n\nThe short voyage has been an exhilarating change of pace from life at court
column5: when we spot it: a distant plume of water
column6:
followed by a small island of wine-dark flesh rolling out of the waves.

The greatest beast of all the deeps.

A #EMP whale#!.":""

drones [knight.GetTitledFirstName] at dinner.

column1: fp1_yearly.0681.desc0:"My $knight_culture_player_plural_no_tooltip_lowercase$ and I are enjoying a fine evening in [ROOT.Char.GetCapitalLocation.GetTitle.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip]

column5: and generally sinking deep into our cups. A good time

column5: I have been consumed with guilt over my deeds
column6: and my [knight.GetFaith.GetAdherentName] thralls tell me that only by accepting [knight.GetFaith.HighGodName] into my heart can my soul be saved.\n\n""It is with a heavy heart that I must leave your sinful court and the awful things I do in your employ.""""":""

column3: and I instinctively know that no trace will be found of [stranger.GetHerHim] come the morn.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1011.desc.separate_religion.critical0:"$fp1_yearly.1011.desc.critical_preamble$Unbeliever!"" Shrieks the ingrate. ""You think you can buy my faith with good table manners and goose-down pillows?! I am a true [stranger.GetFaith.GetAdherentNameNoTooltip]
column2: and I will never abandon the Old Gods! Instead
column3: I'll tell every one of your [ROOT.Char.GetFaith.GetAdjectiveNoTooltip] [ROOT.Char.GetFaith.PriestNeuterPlural] that you sheltered a heathen!""$fp1_yearly.1011.desc.critical_epilogue$""":""

column2: I'd murder you here and now for your blasphemous faith. Fortunately for you
column3: my honor is worth more than your life
column4: and I've contented myself with spreading the word of [stranger.GetFaith.HighGodName] at your court.""$fp1_yearly.1011.desc.standard_epilogue$""":""

column3: but you honor them well. For all that your faith offends the Aesir
column4: you have pleased the Hanged One
column5: and I
column6: Grímnir
column7: shall let the [stranger.GetFaith.PriestNeuterPlural] of the land know.""$fp1_yearly.1011.desc.critical_epilogue$""":""

column2: and you fail to see true divinity within your court
column3: even when Grímnir skulks its very corridors and sits at your table. I pity you
column4: [ROOT.Char.GetWomanMan]ling
column5: for you shall #EMP never#! see my halls of Valhalla!""$fp1_yearly.1011.desc.standard_epilogue$""":""

column3: and I see that you are either shrewd
column4: devout
column5: or both. Either way

column7: and treated the Lord of the Aesir well.""$fp1_yearly.1011.desc.critical_epilogue$""":""

column3: I would be honored to stay at your court permanently?""""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1012.desc.different_faith.critical0:"$fp1_yearly.1012.desc.preamble$My [ROOT.Char.GetLadyLord]! It has been some time since I have been treated so well
column2: and I thank you for your hospitality. I'm afraid
column3: however

column5: a servant of [stranger.GetFaith.HighGodName]
column6: and I have been educating your subjects in [stranger.GetFaith.HighGodHerHis] teachings."""""

column3: but I'm afraid I come here with a confession. Throughout my stay at your court
column4: I have been discussing the works of [stranger.GetFaith.HighGodName] with your subjects
column5: educating whoever will listen in the [stranger.GetFaith.GetAdjectiveNoTooltip] faith.""""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1012.desc.same_faith.critical0:"$fp1_yearly.1012.desc.preamble$Gracious [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip]! I wish to thank you for treating me so well throughout my time here. As a reverent [Select_CString(stranger.IsFemale
column3: stranger.GetFaith.DevoteeMale)] and fellow [stranger.GetFaith.GetAdherentNameNoTooltip]
column4: I have written letters to influential theologians throughout the realm in praise of your piety.""$fp1_yearly.1012.desc.same_faith_epilogue$""":""

column2: I have not been entirely honest with you. Though I look like a beggar
column3: I am really a [Select_CString(stranger.IsFemale

column6: and I have spent my time at court educating and lecturing on the works of [stranger.GetFaith.HealthGodName]. Though you might not have encouraged this

column2: pocketing every piece of shiny metal or exotic textile [stranger.GetSheHe] could find before taking off on my finest horse!":""
taking with [stranger.GetHerHim] all the valuables [stranger.GetSheHe] could get [stranger.GetHerHis] grubby little hands on.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1013.desc.outro0:"\n\nIt seems the mysterious stranger was actually a nithing on the run: convicted of a crime considered so heinous that [stranger.GetSheHe] is now oathless
column3: and considered legally dead by [stranger.GetHerHis] family. This slight is cuts deep.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1013.desc.outro.sodomite0:"\n\nIt seems the mysterious stranger was actually a nithing on the run: ostracized by the community
column3: seeking safe harbor.\n\nWhen my courtiers proved just as conservative as [stranger.GetHerHis] last host's
column4: [stranger.GetSheHe] cut and ran rather than stay and suffer.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1013.b0:"I will not rest till that nithing is found!":""

column4: in truth
column5: I am warrior of fearsome renown! I have been searching for a liege worthy of my services
column6: and your conduct leads me to believe that could be you.""""":""

column4: and my stay at your court makes me think that that could be you.""""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1063.desc.achievements.single.outro0:"a feat that [ship_funeral_candidate.GetSheHe] may never be surpassed in.""
fp1_yearly.1063.desc.achievements.double.intro0: was a person of rare talent and diverse interests. Both""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1063.desc.ship_stone_small0: \n\nThe barrow behind me already contains a small facsimile of a ship
column2: traced in weighty headstones and filled with cobbles
column3: is already buried 'neath a weighty grave of earth.""":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1063.desc.ship_stone_grand0:"\n\nThe great barrow behind me already contains a colossal facsimile of a ship
column2: traced out in runestones and filled with cobbles
column3: each large stone telling stories from the deceased's life.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1063.desc.ship_wood_ornate0:"\n\nThe barrow behind me already contains a purpose-built vessel
column2: the product of exotic woods and our best shipwrights. It will never sail mortal oceans
column3: but may please [ship_funeral_candidate.GetFaith.PantheonTerm] and bring blessings on the deceased.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1063.desc.outro0:"\n\nRetainers carry in the last of the burial treasures
column3: finally
column4: [ship_funeral_candidate.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] corpse laid out atop its bier.":""

column3: fastidiously clean.\n\nOne of life's great delights is hearing even our harshest foes bitterly admit that no man's beard is better combed
column4: no [ROOT.Char.Custom('WomanManPossessive')] hair more regularly soaped
column5: no [ROOT.Char.GetWomanMan]'s face scrubbed quite so clear of blemishes as that of a good [ROOT.Char.GetCulture.GetNameNoTooltip][ROOT.Char.GetWomanMan].\n\nToday is bath-day
column6: but I feel as though a change of routine might do me good. After all
column7: if all the [ROOT.Char.GetCulture.GetNameNoTooltip] are well-groomed
column8: does it not behoove a [ROOT.Char.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip] to be the #EMP best#! groomed?":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1071.a0:"Hygiene is the key to a long life!":""
fp1_yearly.1071.b0:"I suppose I could take a little extra care...":""
fp1_yearly.1081.desc.intro0:"My evening has been consumed by an aged explorer
column3: wishing to tell me the exotic stories of their exploits and adventurers in the Atlantic Ocean.\n\nDespite [norse_explorer.GetHerHis] age
column4: [norse_explorer.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] eyes remain sharp as [norse_explorer.GetSheHe] tells me of":""

column2: struggling $norse_collective_noun$ who live in the snows close to the top of the world. The land is so frozen and cold that they must import all timber
column3: and eat almost entirely meat and fish.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.desc.vinland0:"a land as far west as Cathay is east
column2: where the grapes and wheat grow so freely that they seem to sow themselves
column3: and the vintages are unparalleled. Each local is a fearsome warrior
column4: brooking no intrusion.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.desc.antilia0:"an island settled by [antilia_culture.GetNameNoTooltip] exiles. Rich
column3: living in well-defended castles
column4: they descend from refugees who fled Iberia during the Moorish Invasion.":""

column2: a tiny island in the west populated by $greek_collective_noun$ who share more with ancient $b_athens$ than with modern $b_constantinople$. The locals spend all day discussing philosophy and toasting the glory of the Olympians!":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.desc.fortunate_isles.other0:"the refuge of the last few heathen $hellenic_pagan_adherent_plural$
column2: crudely imitating their distant ancestors in $b_athens$ and $b_thebes$. The locals spend their days in sloth
column3: discussing strange philosophy and practicing their crude faith.":""

column2: where time seems to pass slower within than without. Of the island's further mysteries
column3: [norse_explorer.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] remains tight-lipped
column4: though tears cloud [norse_explorer.GetHerHis] eyes at times.":""

column2: praying and living lives of quiet contemplation. So strong is their faith
column3: each one is immune to mortal weapons
column4: utterly protected by [norse_explorer.GetFaith.HighGodName].":""

column2: rich in golden treasures. So strong was their faith
column3: it filled the isle with beautifully sung hymns even after [norse_explorer.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip]crew put them to the sword.":""

column2: only mentioned in old Islamic texts
column3: thought lost for years. The locals each have piles of gold and silver so large that they use it to make toothpicks and weave their clothes.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.desc.the_sticky_sea0:"a mournful sea within the Atlantic
column3: stinking mess of waters
column4: where serpents and seaweed conspire to drag sailors to their deaths. Only the very strongest of crews stand even a chance of pulling themselves free.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.desc.purple_islands0:"a group of islands far to the south
column3: many of them shades of exotic purple
column4: utterly devoid of any trace of human life. The eerie beauty of the place entices even hardened sailors to lay down and die
column5: at peace with the world.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.desc.hy_brasil0:"an island that remains invisible much of the time
column2: locked behind impenetrable mists save for one day every seven years. Even on the single day when the mists allow travel
column3: no sailor has successfully made landfall.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.desc.thule0:"a vast land to the far
column3: where all matter breaks down. Men breath water and earth as easily as the air
column4: monstrous whales swim through the ground and sky
column5: and all distinctions become academic.":""

column2: where the inhabitants wear only white
column3: carry cruel spears
column4: and fight viciously against each other and even the noblest of visitors. The locals worship ancient
column5: pagan deities
column6: long-forgotten by right-thinking [norse_explorer.GetFaith.GetAdherentNamePluralNoTooltip].":""

column2: where the inhabitants wear only white
column3: carry cruel spears
column4: and fight with inhuman strength and ferocity. So legendary is their prowess
column5: no warrior of this land has ever fallen to a foreign blade.":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.desc.sunset_empire0:"an empire on the far side of the very widest point of the Atlantic
column3: skulls
column4: and hungry conquerors
column5: lurking just beneath the western horizon. Its cruel masters wait for Ragnarok itself
column6: when they intend to rip the beating hearts from all good [norse_explorer.GetFaith.GetAdherentNamePluralNoTooltip].":""

column2: [norse_explorer.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] seems more than willing to carry on if I wish.":""

column3: from the top!":""

column1: fp1_yearly.1081.b0:"You cannot #EMP possibly#! be telling me the truth
fp1_yearly.1081.c0:"Tales of far-away lands are always soothing...":""
fp1_yearly.1081.c.sunset_empire0:"Perhaps we should stop ships sailing west...":""
